text: Appearances more less like other jockeys appear yellow and clear. Similarly Aroma is like other sake but perhaps a bit more mild. Flavor is similarly like other side is not as complex little bit sweet up front and a bit of an alcohol burn in the back. Okay buddy and finish.

720ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Very pale yellow colour, no head and aroma of rice & woody cedar spice. Taste is rice, melon, cedar wood, spicy, peppery, alcohol. Oily mouthfeel, medium bodied, low carbonation, warming finish with lingering spice. Quite drinkable.
Pear cider color, still, light legs left on glass. Aroma of honey, vanilla, cedar, and alcohol. Taste of honey, wood, stone fruit, rice, stronger alcohol bite.

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2015 Bottle at SB&WF 2015, on September 24, 2015.Was told this was from Kiuchi brewery, but also named Kikusakari. From a town/region of Mito / Ibaraki. At 15% ABV. Seems it does fit in here.Clear birch sap/pear color. Some legs. Sweet, pear, some alcohol, fresh scent. Alcohol, a bit tart, smooth taste. Smooth mouthfeel, tart finish.

Bottle at home #5 Taru rate yippee and seeing this has so many rates surprisingly havent come across before. Light yellow tinged pour. Nose is musty cedar and some honey. Tastes of faint cedar, grainy, melon, pepper, honey, some alcohol. Not particularly smooth. Spice on finish.

Appearance: Clear color with no head.Aroma: Yeast, rice, mild fruity and some oak.Palate: Medium body. Slightly sweet and a mild bitterness. Soft carbonation.Taste: Yeast, mild oak, alcohol, rice and light fruity.Overall impression: A nice girl tried to learn me something about sake. And I think she was clever. For the first time I liked it. It had a round mild texure. Taru means barrel aged.Personal stats: Bottle at Beer13 in Oslo, Norway
Bottle. Pours a clear color with no head. Has a fruity yeasty week woody cedar aroma. Sweetish spicy weak apple and cedar flavor. Has a fruity yeasty spicy finish.

300ml bottle.
Pours almost water clear, green tinge, no head.
Spicy aroma, wood, pepper, rice, yeast.
Dry, light bodied, no carbonation.
Peppery, woody, spicy taste, rice, yeast, grapefruit peel, slightly floral.
(2012-01-10)

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Rather watery colour. Very peppery notes along with some mild wood in the aroma. Flavour is rather wooden, with some slight cedar, spices and mild sweetness as well.

Gift from Sj. White almost clear pour. With an aroma of dirt, wood and sugar.

The taste was alcohol , rice and fruit. Ifind it hard to rate these.

From a bottle at Fountainhead. Its still and quite clear, perhaps a hint of yellow in the middle. Nose is fragrant, peppery cedar, melon & earth. Some alcohol notes as well. On taste, the cedar is pretty subdued, lending some woody notes. Earthy koji and fresh sticky rice. More of the melon notes and perfume. A nice fruity note comes through. Finish is clean. Reasonably full bodied as well. Pretty interesting stuff.

Strong and unmistakable aroma of black pepper and honey. Clear pale yellow. Light flavor, thin mouthfeel. Alcohol well concealed. Delayed honey flavor with balck pepper and must accents. Nice woody finish. Weak in intensity, but thats a good thing given the subtle nuances of this sake. Unique and quite nice.
courtesy of bu11zeye. Clear, nearly colorless body. Fruit berry, yeasty boozy aromas. Big alcohol, rice cake, woody, berry fruit flavors-- may have enjoyed this more if it wasnt so boozy.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: bottle, thanks to bu11zeye, clear color with thin legs, bamboo , melon astringent aroma, flavor of bamboo, melon with a hot finish
(Bottle, via trade with BMan1113VR)  Pours a transparent body with descent legs.  Aroma of coconut, sweat, vanilla, melon, rubbing alcohol, and smoked husks.  Flavor of melon, rice milk, and cedar.
Bottle courtesy bu11zeye. Clear white color. No carbonation. Aroma is powdery and old musty. Flavor is powdery sweet with some musty old taste. Grandmas perfume. Weird finish.
bottle thanks to bu11zeye.  poured clear with a yellow tint and great legs.  nose is cedar, pear, fruits, and light alcohol.  not bad on the palate, flavor is cedar, dried frutis, and light vanilla.

Thanks to bu11zeye for sharing this bottle. Clear with great legs. The aroma is a great mix of rice, cedar and some citrus notes. The flavor is cedar and rice, but I also get some vanilla and almonds as well as some melon and citrus notes. The alcohol is very well hidden. Very nice.

720ml version. Clear with a slight yellow/beige hue. Pretty solid legs. Aromas of honey, melon (honey dew), lychee, vanilla, cedar, cotton candy, bubble gum, dry riesling (minimal koji, surprisingly considering other ratings). Extremely fruity and floral aroma. Very light peppery alcohol notes. Flavor is a bit stronger on the koji. Earthy, woody, mushrooms, umami, cedar, pepper. Light plastic and grape notes. Very mellow alcohol (practically non existent). Medium weighted body. Medium duration. Good sake.
Taster at the brewery. Round, mellow, nice flavor and the cedar doesnt take over everything as much as in some Taru sake. You can still taste the rice. Nice enough.

Bottle Crystal clear sake. A couple swirls of the glass leave a beautiful ring near the top that slowly melts and morphs into twenty or so snake-like legs winding down into the drink. The cedar aging produces a wonderful cracked pepper nose. Medium to full-bodied with an oily/fatty mouthfeel. Sweet, but crisp, and a touch woody and peppery. Finishes off warming and lightly sweet and leaves a trace of spicy wood on my tongue.
Sampled at Aleksey Spirits tasting in Nashville.  Got sweet malt for the aroma and flavor.

900ml, straw wrapped, short round barrel.  Pours clear, simple syrup colored, with very nice legs.  Sweet aroma of ripe honeydew melon, and a hint of cedar planks.  Smooth, creamy texture.  Finishes with a medium dryness.  Flavor of sweet rice, cedar wood, some tropical fruit and light honey.  Finishes with a flavor of a grapefruit half.  Overall, very oily and deep bodied.  By far, this sake has the most uniqueness of character from any sake I have tried.  Very full bodied, smooth, and easy to drink.  
My 1800th Rating!

Bottled. A water colored sake. The aroma is sweet and dominated by cedar wood, while the flavor is sweet with notes of rices, cedar wood, and alcohol, and the body is powerful. Thanks Storm for sharing.

Bottle 72cl.Clear white color with virtually none head. Aroma is alcohol, pepperry, woody. Flavor is pepperry and alcohol with a long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft, finish feel is moderate alcoholic. (130608)

Sipped chilled.  Poured clear with legs.  The aroma had a light rice sweetness with an earthy wood background.  A rough alcohol was in the nose.  The flavor was had a touch of fruit mixed with rice meal and alcohol on the finish.  Meh it was ok.
(Bottle 72 cl) Courtesy of Storm. Crystal clear with no head. Spicy, vanilla-like nose. Medium body with a soft mouthfeel. Dry, piney accents. 190408

Again a crystal clear appearance, very light and still.  The aroma are very present of woodiness due to the Akita cedar, that is unmistakeable.  Alcohol is very present and almost smells like floor polish.  Piney flavors, with some honey sweetness and lots of alcohol.  Not the most pleasant thing I have ever drank.
Bottle. A water coloured sake with no head. The aroma and taste is like glue and wood. Medium body with a glue like finish. YAK!
Clear with no head. Sweet fruity aroma with alcohol notes. Sweet alcoholic flavor with notes of spices and honey. Ends sweet.

72 cl. Bottle [Thanks to Storm] See throught pale glowing color. Aroma of sweet flower, wood, pine nedel, alcohol. Full bodied an alcoholic texture. Alcoholic pine and flower lingering finish. 
7-3-7-3-14
19-04-2008
72 cL bottle. Pours clear and pale to white head. Aroma is light alcoholic. Flavour pinewood dry to just woody. Dry and light alcohol woody finish.

Pours a crystal clear pale yellow tint.  The still body appears to be on the moderate side, as the thin layer of sheeting quickly retreats.  The aroma is quite peppery, with intense, fumy cedar dominating notes of koji, cream, and moist bread.  The flavor is again heavily wooded, spicy, and slightly medicinal.  Creamy, yeasty notes are underlying.  The medium body has a smooth texture, but it goes down quite hot, burning the throat on the way down.  I was not overly impressed with this, my first Tarusake experience.

6oz bottle from theCheeseman, I think? Someone from Florida.  Pours clear and light, I would almost call it clear and colorless like water, but there is a slight brown/yellow/tan hue, but just barely.  Oily and thick on the sides of the glass, with sheets instead of legs, and the viscosity of olive oil.  It looks great.  Nose is a combination of chemicals, rice noodles,  medicinal strawberries, white grapes and peach rind, and a bit of a burnt black pepper note as well. Flavor:  biting and sharp up front, then lightly sweet over the middle, settling into a very light, lively but pale and near-flavorless rice, grape and water state.  A little hot, and a little bit more of that chemical cleaner flavor that I could do without, but its an interesting drink, unlike anything Ive had before.

Thanks to the guys at Knightly for turning me on to this! Pours out nice and clear. You can definitely tell the cedar barrel influence on the aroma, giving it a woody peppery aroma. As this get colder, I started to get more fruit in the taste along with some alcohol and pepper. Leaves a hint of fruit in the aftertaste. Very clean smooth drink that is much better than any other sake I have had before.
Musty cedar aroma, with spices and alcohol.  Pours clear.  Smooth cedar, sweet rice, yeasty, peppermint, feels thick and creamy yet very thin.  Excellent!

Sampled at the Milwaukee YEHa!05 courtesy of JPDIPSO: Pale clear transparent pour has thin legs.  Sweet complex floral ricce and cedar aroma has notes of coconut milk.  Starts with a thin, sweet milky viscosity and a touch of mild woody flavor with a warming, thin alcoholic finish.  An interesting sake, and I like the cedar character, but it could be thicker and hide its alcohol a little better.
Clear body, thick legs.  Alcohol, pear skin, floral sweetness (like eating a petal), and cedar.  Cedar + alcohol, powdered sugar and floral sweetness.  Some burny alcohol and grain in the finish.

Thanks to JPDIPSO for bringing this one.  Noticeable ceder in the aroma with a hint of black pepper (weird?) and some mint.  Very clear with some legs.  Noticable alcohol that changed to ceder but then quickly changed to a vanilla rice soft finish.  Interesting combination there.  Lighter bodied with a watery feel to it.

Clear water like appearance with viscous legs streaming down the glass.  Toasted almonds in the aroma, along with something reminiscent of buttercream face lotion.  Alcohol is definitely discernable, and joins up with spearmint and chlorine splattered sauna panels.  Floral lilac pedals and some wooden smoothness in the flavor.  Thanks for the experience, JPDIPSO.

Clear w some leg
Smells nice light sweet some light coconut
Light pal
Taste is light coconut sweet some grain & alcohol
Pretty good.
Thanks to John!  Pours to a clear watery body with nice legs.  The aroma is melons, rice, wood, cedar.  The flavor is much of the same as the flavor.  The palate is decent.  Soft.
Pours light yellow.  Smells of rice and woody.  Taste is of rice and warming alcohol.  Very one dimensional, even for a sake.

Clear with very faint yellow hues. Thick drooping legs. The aroma is interesting and a bit different then the other sakes I have tried. Melon (on the verge of being bad), cedar, pepper, and alcohol. The flavor is quite nice. The cedar really comes out late. Up front it is more melon and some sweetness. Before and immediately after the swallow the cedar kicks in. Soft and full mouthfeel. This is probably my favorite sake that I have tried. Graned my sample size is small.

720ml glass bottle. No head (still). Body is clear extremely light yellow (almost colorless). Aroma is notes of rice, wood, alcohol, honeydew melon rind, glue. Flavor is moderately sweet, moderately acidic. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic. Light to medium body, watery texture, flat carbonation, moderately alcoholic. Decent, enjoyable, but not all that exciting...expected more cedar character.

Pretty clear. Just a tiny little hint of some kind of coloring. Light alcohol with some woody notes and some spice. There is a touch of melon as well. Sweet and alcoholy. (I know thats not a word, but oh well.) Something cloying in the end there. The alcohol is clearing the old sinus. Not too shabby.

720mL Bottle: Clear almost beige tinge, nice ropey legs. The aroma is thick with koji and light pepper with a hint of cedar. The flavor has a sweet impact with a muffled alcohol mouthfeel. Finishes dry and rounded. The tail is lingering with dry and acidic notes but very refreshing. I really enjoyed this sake!
BW3 downtown Indy. No head, no bubbles. Body was transparent and clear hue. Aroma was alcohol as was the flavor. Burning alcohol mouthfeel.

This wonderfully wicker casked brew with a side tap was poured into a small tasting cup and placed in a wooden square contained then served to be at the Buffalo Wild Wiings restaurant on Maryland Ave in Indianapolis on our wedding night.  It poured a crystal clear transparent body with no head and no bubbles.  It had a mild alcohol Sake aroma and a flat initial mouth feel that later turned into a burning one in the finish yet was smooth and well balanced.    The flavor was burning with alcohol and much like other Sakes.

Clear with a light hint of yellow. Small thin legs. Strong alcohol nose, near burning, with undertones of epoxy and cedar. Light sweetness in the front with some coconut and rice milk. Middle and finish carry the alcohol flavor. with out being overly warming or abusive. Silky and smooth in feel. Touch of gin late in the finish. Quite enjoyable.
